alert.note: Alert for Barton; Ellsworth; Lincoln; McPherson; Rice; Russell; Saline (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 7:47PM CST until January 12 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with some locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph will cause blowing and drifting snow and low visibilities at times. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerous bitter cold wind chills are forecast. Wind chills values of 15 to 35 below zero are likely this weekend through early next week. * WHERE...Portions of Central Kansas. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Friday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Snow and blowing snow could reduce visibilities below a mile at times and create poor road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The bitter cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Barton; Ellsworth; Lincoln; McPherson; Rice; Russell; Saline
